intro: Schizolepis abortiva, commonly known as the abortive schizolepis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Schizolepis abortiva is typically found in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes.
